intro: Xanthophyllum palawanense, commonly known as the Palawan yellowwood, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant is typically found in lowland and montane forests, growing as a small to medium-sized evergreen tree. It produces small, clustered flowers that are often yellow or greenish-yellow in color. Xanthophyllum palawanense is valued for its timber and is also an important component of the local flora in its native habitat.
